text: {{Infobox writer | name = Elsie Johansson | image = Elsie Johansson.JPG | image_size = 200px | alt = | caption = Elsie Johansson at the Gothenburg Book Fair in 2008. | pseudonym = | birth_name = Elsie Gunborg Johansson | birth_date = | birth_place = Vendel, Sweden | death_date = | death_place = | resting_place = | occupation = Writer | language = Swedish | nationality = Swedish | ethnicity = | citizenship = | education = | alma_mater = | period = 1979–2016 | genre = | subject = | movement = | notableworks = Brorsan hade en vevgrammofon (1979) Glasfåglarna (1996) Mosippan (1998) Nancy (2001) Sin ensamma kropp (2008) Riktiga Elsie (2016) | spouse = | partner = | children = | relatives = | influences = | influenced = | awards = | signature = | signature_alt = | website = | portaldisp = }} Elsie Gunborg Johansson (1 May 1931 – 15 February 2025) was a Swedish writer. She is sometimes considered a proletarian writer. She became popular as a writer because of her Nancy trilogy (Glasfåglarna, Mosippan and Nancy). It earned her several awards such as the Aniara Prize. Johansson also received the Litteris et Artibus award. Johansson died on 15 February 2025, at the age of 93. ==References== Category:1931 births Category:2025 deaths Category:Swedish writers
title: Elsie Johansson
